newsitem.title: INDIA: Indians whip 200 million working animals daily.
newsitem.headline: Indians whip 200 million working animals daily.

text.p: Indian owners of some 200 million working animals, including bullocks, buffaloes, elephants, horses and donkeys, whip them at least once a day, the head of an animal welfare group said on Tuesday.

The Press Trust of India (PTI) quoted Animal Welfare Board of India (AWBI) chairman Lieutenant General A.K. Chatterjee as saying the government was expected to tighten an existing law to increase fines on people who are cruel to animals.
Chatterjee told a news conference in the southern city of Madras that legal rights would be conferred on animal welfare officials and organisations to enforce the new law.
The government has proposed 220 million rupees ($6.1 million) in grants to the AWBI to boost animal welfare in the country where a large number of species are used in farming, transport and circuses.
